_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:19 using v2.7
title: How have the number of calls resulting in an emergency response changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
Between January 2012 and 2017 the number of category A calls (Red 1 and Red 2 calls combined) that result in an emergency response generally remained around 2.5 million, though there was a noticeable peak in March 2016 (over 3 million). The sudden drop in performance in December 2014 and March 2016 (shown in the first chart) was accompanied by a rise in activity during this period. However, increased activity is not correlated with all drops in perforamnce, as shown by the two charts above. This suggests other factors may be influencing the ability of the ambulance service to meet the target of attending 75% of category A calls within eight minutes.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
